\"Y-you bought crap on a whim now you\u2019re out on a limb repossessed by the Devil today In the London hotels where the suits go to lunch if you beg your way into the feast you\u2019ll see Major, the Devil\u2019s trainspotter _ ancj I ^ m o m ^ * neighbour of the beast making jokes with their friends in the City whose promises put you in hock and talking of regeneration while the bailiffs are changing the lock \u2014^ B u t again you believed what they told you on your hand-picked excursion to Hell \u2018Ah, it\u2019s better the Devil you know, mate!\u2019 Now you\u2019ve got to know him far too well... 11 Attila 11-21 18/9/92 12:10 am Page 1 t i p p tc f Va C C-* ~ - Repossessed by the Devil In the days of the old never-never when your house rose in price with each day in a right to buy giveaway con-trick to make millions vote Margaret\u2019s way you mortgaged your income to Satan Doctor Faustus of Shoreham-by-Sea saw the homeless in the bed & breakfasts and thought how the hell can that be so* you borrowed the earth in the eighties when the plastic explosion held sway 'ty o u r repayments are late so this is your fate - repossessed by the Devil today Now you used to be prudent and thrifty till Satan\u2019s slaves took you in hand You are what you buy was the corporate cry in a don\u2019t pay till next year land No matter you\u2019re stretched to the limit CUw(dlof, \n￼Attila 11-21 18/9/92 12:10 am Page 12, A man was beaten to death in August 1992 at a burger stall in Kingston-upon-Thames by-»e«©pbeb4e4©ealthtt«9-because, though English, he was speaking in French to his female companions... Language Barrier \u2018Oi, you! Whaddya talking foreign for? You\u2019re English like us, aintcha? So whaddya talking foreign for? Nice birds though, ya done alright there, mate But watcha talking like that for? Oh, they don\u2019t speak English, don\u2019t they? Well, whyya bovvering with them Froggie slags then? Talking never did any good anyway - give us \u2019em over \u2019ere, they can talk to our meat, that\u2019s Esperanto, innit? Watcha sayin to em? Oi, cunt, watcha sayin to \u2019em? Talkin bahrt us, are ya? Fuckin wanker Bet ya think yer really clever-clever, dontcha, talking foreign so we can\u2019t understand ya trying to impress those birds with yer fancy lingo - fucking university wanker Hey, Del boy, shall we TALK to \u2019im, eh? Poncy cunt - let\u2019s teach him a REAL lesson, eh? Oh, not so mouthy now, are we, wanker? Well, it\u2019s too late - we\u2019re gonna kick some good British sense into yer, aren\u2019t we, lads? No use begging now, ya student tosser!\u2019 and the boots went in the fists went in and he went down the boots went in again the fists went in again and the lights went out on a life destroyed in a blind moment of hatred by the psychopathic flotsam of Thatcherism\u2019s own - and let\u2019s have no excuses, no bullshit sociology, 12 \n￼Attila 11-21 18/9/92 12:10 am Page 13, no talk of deprivation, of mitigating circumstances - Kingston-on-Thames? No, these were just mean-spirited scum, celebrating the values of the last thirteen years - the values of crass ignorance selfishness violence and of course \u2018pride in being British\u2019. Was it for this, the 1944 Education Act? People are murdered every day, of course - in this nasty, brutish zit of a country, often for even more unbelievably banal reasons - so why this poem? Simply that I remember a visit to a pub my own bilingual conversation (it\u2019s a skill, you know, you learn it, like medicine or carpentry - a skill that most Europeans take for granted) and the broken beer glass and the contorted face of the thug when I replied to his insult in his own tongue - For me it ended differently but when I saw that story in the paper a shiver ran down my spine I remembered that evening in the pub and the impotent anger swelled uncontrollably in my guts... One final thought; I bet THIS senseless murder didn\u2019t make the tabloid headlines: After all, The Paper That Supports Our Boys wouldn\u2019t want to alienate its readership, would it? 13 \n￼ACtila 11-21 18/9/92 12:10 am Page 14, In the vanguard of the stultifying wave of social and political apathy currently festering across our nation we find The Kids. Their immediate forebears were radical hippies and wild-eyed punk rockers who rioted, vomited, went on demonstrations and generally stood up and spat. This bunch \u2014who\u2019ve actually got far more to he angry about than the last couple of generations - - .seenwaw happier with a sensible haircut, a nice cup of cocoa and a _ Chris Rea LP........ \u2014 The Blank Generation)^ (A new slant on an age-old theme) The youth of today don\u2019t know they\u2019re born ...at the age of five, they\u2019re mowing the lawn \u2014 Sdfy the time they\u2019re eight, their golden dream is a foolproof, high-yield pension scheme As puberty strikes, know where they are? Out there on Sundays, washing the car Birthdays and Christmas, the same old cry: \u2018Please, please, Mum, can I have a new tie?\u2019 Games: \u2018You be a company director, I\u2019ll be the local tax inspector.\u2019 Teenage rebellion: \u2018Grow up, Dad, and buy a suit, you look real sad!\u2019 Music: Doors and Rolling Stones (!) and bleepy acid monotones* (*though some arereally daring creatures - \u2014 they like Blur and Manic Street Preachers) A Politics: Grey. A tinge of green from time to time, to suit the scene. 14
